lead_paragraph: Civilians are dying from lack of food and medical care as the Syrian government tightens sieges and increases airstrikes in Aleppo and outside Damascus.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and KARAM SHOUMALI

headline.print_headline: Pro-Government Forces Tighten Their Siege Around Syria’s Biggest City
headline.main: Pro-Government Forces Advance in Syria Amid Talk of U.S.-Russia Cooperation

snippet: Civilians are dying from lack of food and medical care as the Syrian government tightens sieges and increases airstrikes in Aleppo and outside Damascus....
abstract: Pro-government forces tighten siege around Aleppo, Syria, raising threat that country's largest city will become inaccessible to food and medical supplies like several other areas; both supporters and opponents of Pres Bashar al-Assad say he is hoping to extend his campaign as far as possible before January, when new American president may take tougher line in Syria.
